post.body: Loving the new album (FYI: Amazon has a $3.99 download 2day) Wish I'd come to the Chicago show. Oh, finals. Nice work, though! :)
I'm assuming you're on your way now. If so, hope you're having a nice flight. Let us know when you get there! Miss you already!
Very pretty header! Chicago <3.
Why kids should be allowed to play video games. It's your basic persuasive 5-7 paragraph essay.
Hoping for better dreams tonight... Any dream involving Dakota Fanning dishing out relationship advice automatically becomes a nightmare.
God, why am I still awake? I need a normal sleep schedule. On the plus side, my little blue & white & silver X-mas tree looks ahhhmazing.
As much as I enjoy waking up to a quiet house, I'm anxious for my family to start vacation. Not enjoying how stressed they are every night.
Final draft of bro's paper is, in a word, bitchin'. He better get an A. He told his teacher, who I had in HS, that I was helping him.
Soup was magnificent, as I expected. None of my OWN homework to do tonight - just working with Ty on his final draft. Sigh.
Mom is making potato soup for dinner - one of my all-time favorites. So, so good.
I'm sort of dreading my family all coming home. I wasn't up this morning, so I don't know if things have blown over at all yet.
Finally got up around 12:30 to break up a literal catfight. Plan is to shower, scan in some old pics, and work on cleaning a little.
Gee, I really should get up and be a valuable member of society. But my bed is warm, and I'm still sleepy.
My mom doesn't get my pop culture references, but she pretends that she does. If it transcends SNL or The Today Show, she's clueless.
Okay, more like 4 days. But still. That's a long time.
I miss my friends. Haven't interacted with anyone my age in about 5 days.
Everyone is finally asleep, so I'm venturing out for a snack. Why can't I have a normal, drama-free family? I know NOBODY does, but still.
No call from work yet (knock on wood), so I'm getting dressed for my brother's away game an HOUR away tonight. Gee, IDK why I'm not excited.
Tripped over my suitcase at 3 AM and twisted my ankle, which still hurts. This is God telling me it's time to unpack.
Oh, wow, it's 2:00. I should probably sleep now. Writing out Christmas cards is beginning to feel like more of a chore than anything.
AIMing it up with tcvalerie. We both needed it, I think.
Everyone is pretty much asleep already. Happy Birthday, Jesus. Sorry your party is so lame.
Hahahahahaha my grandpa is reading my mom's Redbook. Intently.
Helped put away leftovers and feed all the kitties, and now I'm trying to avoid another night of watching crappy Hallmark movies.
And to be fair, I AM sick. I would be in a much better mood if I didn't have a painful cough and constant headache.
Lola is sleeping next to me, and dinner is almost ready downstairs. I really am lucky, even if I act like kind of a brat sometimes.
R.I.P. Harold Pinter. I loved "Birthday Party" when we read it in Modern Drama a couple years ago.
Made out nicely this morning -- and got a DVR. Yay! Merry Whatever-You-Celebrate to all. Currently slothing it up in the living room.
With any luck, I'll be feeling better in the morning and have a better attitude. I was totally the party pooper of the family this evening.
Long day at work, glad it's been over for a while. Three presents left to wrap, but I'm still feeling sick-ish so I'm probably going to bed.
Apparently my job is significantly less important than new furniture.
Now I'm mad. Because my mom insisted on having her table delivered this morning, and the van is stuck and I can't get to work. FML.
Wide awake at 6 AM, but I made the mistake of laying back down for an hour, and now I'm sleepy. Leaving early to pick up my mom's gift.
Power has been back for an hour, so I showered and now I'm going to watch Sabrina in bed. Big big big big day tomorrow.
Lights & water still out. Did I mention how much I hate well water? Family is being obnoxiously loud with dice, so I can't sleep.
Power: out. Me: grouchy.
My grandma negotiated today w/ the Amish furniture store to get 15% off and Xmas Eve delivery on a HUGE new dining room table for us. Yay!!!
Sent home from work 3 hrs early b/c of icy weather. I kind of wanted to stay, but I've been feeling all fever-y and dizzy today so I didn't.
Trying not to sound/look as bad as my throat and head feel because I don't want to gross out my customers. I keep losing my voice, though.
I have one more gift to buy after work tonight - hope the weather doesn't get bad again.
